metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15437 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
The Linux kernel before version 5.8 is vulnerable to a NULL pointerdereference indrivers/tty/serial/8250/8250_core.c:serial8250_isa_init_ports() that allowslocal users to cause a denial of service by using the p->serial_in pointerwhich uninitialized.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15437` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-189-generic - 4.4.0-189.219~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-189-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-189.219~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-189-lowlatency - 4.4.0-189.219~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-189-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-189.219~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-189-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-189.219~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-189-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-189.219~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-189-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-189.219~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-189-generic - 4.4.0-189.219~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-189-lowlatency - 4.4.0-189.219~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1077-aws - 4.4.0-1077.81
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1093-azure - 4.15.0-1093.103~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-189.219~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1077.81').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1093.103~14.04.1').
